newsitem.title: UK: Royal Bank up, in talks with Scottish Widows.
newsitem.headline: Royal Bank up, in talks with Scottish Widows.

text.p: Shares in Royal Bank of Scotland Group Plc rose on Thurdsay in a firm banking sector after the company said it was in talks with mutually-owned life insurer Scottish Widows about co-operating in a number of areas.
The group's shares added 3p to 491-1/2p by 1011 GMT.
Analysts said it was a positive move for Royal Bank of Scotland but was unlikely to drive the share price much higher in the short term.

One of the principal benefits to Royal Bank will be the expertise of Scottish Widows in the UK life and pensions market, said analysts, though there was unlikely to be any immediate major impact on the company's profitability.
"Royal Bank will be effectively outsourcing their life and pension administration" to Scottish Widows, said one analyst.
